content: He has full access to the room

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message indicating that a user has full access to a room. It appears in an info panel on the Home page and is part of a tooltip that shows permissions related to room ownership or admin status.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Otağa tam giriş imkanı var' while conveying the general idea, isn't the most natural or direct translation of 'He has full access to the room'. 'Giriş imkanı var' (has the possibility of entry) is a bit verbose. A more accurate and fluent translation would be something like 'Otağa tam hüququ var' or 'Otağa sərbəst daxil ola bilir'.

While "rajoittamaton pääsy" translates to "unrestricted access," the English phrase "full access" implies a complete and unrestricted allowance, but doesn't necessarily highlight the 'unrestricted' aspect. A more direct translation might be more appropriate depending on the nuance intended.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Hänellä on täysi pääsy huoneeseen' which directly translates to 'He has full access to the room'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "ルームへのフルアクセスを持っています" is a literal translation but sounds unnatural in Japanese. 'Has full access' implies permission or ability. A more natural translation would convey that sense.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ルームへのアクセス権を持っています (Room no access ken o motte imasu - I have access rights to the room) or ルームへのアクセスが可能です (Room e no access ga kanou desu - Access to the room is possible).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation '방에 대한 전체 액세스 권한이 있습니다' is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Korean. It's overly formal and doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'full access' as smoothly as it could.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like '방에 자유롭게 드나들 수 있습니다' (can freely enter and exit the room) or '방을 마음대로 사용할 수 있습니다' (can use the room freely).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ລາວມີການເຂົ້າເຖິງຫ້ອງຢ່າງເຕັມທີ່' is a literal translation of 'He has full access to the room'. While understandable, it's somewhat formal and less natural in Lao. A more natural phrasing would convey the same meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ລາວສາມາດເຂົ້າຫ້ອງໄດ້ເຕັມທີ່ (Lao samart khao hong dai tem thi)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'Este acordat acces complet la sala' translates more literally to 'Access is granted to the room.' It doesn't accurately convey the 'He has' part of the original English sentence, which indicates possession or a direct attribute.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation could be 'El are acces complet la sala' (He has full access to the room) or 'Are acces complet la sala' (Has full access to the room).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Russian translation "У него есть полный доступ в комнату" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "He has full access to the room." While literally translatable, it sounds awkward. A more idiomatic translation would use the preposition 'к'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: У него есть полный доступ к комнате

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ඔහුට/ඇයට කාමරය වෙත පූර්ණ ප්‍රවේශය ඇත' is a literal translation that doesn't quite capture the natural flow of the English sentence 'He has full access to the room'. While technically correct, it sounds somewhat stiff in Sinhala.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation might be 'ඔහුට කාමරයට නිදහස් ප්‍රවේශය ඇත' or 'ඔහුට කාමරයට අවි බාධී ප්‍රවේශය ඇත'. (He has unrestricted access to the room).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Ima poln dostop do sobe' translates to 'He/She has full access to the room' but the sentence starts with 'Ima' (he/she has), which might be confusing. A more accurate translation maintaining the same meaning would be 'On ima poln dostop do sobe' (He has full access to the room) or 'Ona ima poln dostop do sobe' (She has full access to the room). The original sentence's pronoun is not specified.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'On ima poln dostop do sobe' or 'Ona ima poln dostop do sobe' to be explicit about the subject.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the translation conveys the general meaning, 'приступ' (pristup) typically implies 'access' in a more functional or permission-based sense, rather than the complete access implied by 'full access'. A more accurate translation would reflect the totality of the access.

While the Vietnamese translation is understandable, "toàn quyền sử dụng" is a more formal and less natural way to express "full access." A more colloquial and accurate translation would convey the sense of being able to use the room freely and without restriction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Người ấy có thể sử dụng phòng thoải mái

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '有完整的房间访问权限' (yǒu wánzhěng de fángjiān fǎngwèn quánxiàn) is a literal and somewhat awkward translation of 'He has full access to the room.' It emphasizes 'complete room access permission' which isn't the natural way a Chinese speaker would express this. It lacks nuance and sounds overly formal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural and accurate translation would be something like: '他可以完全进入房间' (tā kěyǐ wánquán jìnrù fángjiān) – 'He can completely enter the room', or '他有权进入房间' (tā yǒu quánxiàn jìnrù fángjiān) - 'He has the right to enter the room'.
